title: Chargrilled Spring Onion and Lemon Ricotta on toast
description: Spring onions have a similar flavour to baby leeks (with out the extortionate price tag), and char-grilling them brings out a delicious smoky-sweet flavour. Swap the ricotta for any mild and soft flavoured cheese if you fancy. And use any herbs you have available - basil or mint would work nicely.

ingredients: A couple of sage leaves, chopped

method: Heat a griddle pan to almost smoking, then gently place 5 spring onions (small) on to it. Leave them undisturbed for a couple of minute (to ensure they get nice and even griddle marks), then turn them over and repeat.
Meanwhile toast 1 large piece of bread, and mix together 60g ricotta, 1/2 lemon zest, 1/4 lemon juiced and 1 tsp of olive oil, plus salt to season. Spread across the toast.
Gently place the spring onions over the ricotta mix, drizzle with 1 tsp of hazelnut oil (or olive oil) and sprinkle with some sea salt and a couple of chopped sage leaves. Eat immediately.
